fxInfo_citation: Pemstein et al. (2018, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2018:21); V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
fxInfo_clarification: Subnational elections refer to elections to regional or local offices, as specified above.
fxInfo_cross_coder_aggregation: Bayesian Item Response Theory Measurement Model
fxInfo_ordering: If answer is "2", skip remaining questions in this section.
fxInfo_question: Does the freeness and fairness of subnational elections vary across different areas of the country?

fxInfo_responses.value: Yes. Subnational elections in some areas of the country are significantly more free and fair(or, alternatively, significantly less free and fair) than subnational elections in other areas of the country.
Somewhat. Subnational elections in some areas of the country are somewhat more free and fair (or, alternatively, somewhat less free and fair) than subnational elections in other areas of the country.
No. Subnational elections in most or all areas of the country are equally free and fair (or, alternatively, equally not free and not fair).

fxInfo_scale: Ordinal, converted to interval by the measurement model
name: v2elsnlsff, *_osp, *_ord
